result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/PAC >= .02 Under IID Order (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/PAC >= .02 Under IID Order (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Sandra L Robertson was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Sandra L Robertson was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: FTP Warrant and Notice of Certification - Tax Intercept mailed to Defendant have been returned via USPS.  Return to Sender.  Moved.  Left No Address.  Unable to Forward.
sent to GLSO May 5, 2017
Warrant Letter mailed to Defendant has been returned.  Return to Sender.  Moved.  Left No Address.  Unable to Forward.
from Clerk to Defendant re: Warrant

1:04 pm
No Appearance by Defendant.  Court orders Warrant.
Court adjourned at 1:04 pm
Summons for FTP mailed to Defendant has been returned via USPS.  Return to Sender.  Moved.  Left No Address.  Unable to Forward.
FTP Hearing April 24, 2017, for $2,103.50

12:05 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Joey Roeth.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to counts 1 & 2 on 2016CM157 and count 1 on 2016CM125 and the balance of the counts will be dismissed and read-in.  State concurs.  Atty Roeth concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on: 2016CM125 count 1 as charged and orders counts 2 & 3 be dismissed and read-in.  Court finds the defendant guilty on:  2016CM157 counts 1 & 2 and orders count 3 be dismissed outright and counts 4 & 5 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Roeth.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2016CM157 (Count 1)

-Court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

2016CM157 (Count 2)

-28 days county jail, consecutive to any other sentence.  Sentence is to commence within 60 days.  Court grants the defendant huber, out of county service and out of county travel.
-$500 fine plus costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Blood Draw Fees - $42.50
-DL Revocation - 16 months
-IID - 16 months
-AODA & any follow-up(GL)
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court grants the defendant 1 day of sentence credit.

2016CM125 (Count 1)

-Court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court orders the restiution be paid out to the victim.

Court adjourned at 12:17 p.m.

Plea/sentencing hearing on December 20, 2016 at 10:00 am.

10:16 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Joey Roeth.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Roeth - matters are resolved and request an adjournment as defendant is starting a new job.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on December 20, 2016 at 10:00 a.m.

ADDRESS INFO for Sandra L Robertson

Prior: 151 S Wisconsin St Apt D, Berlin, WI 54923
Defendant's Notice of Change of Address - New address is:  246 Washington St Apt 206  Berlin, WI  54923
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 24, 2016 at 10:00 am.

10:08 A.M.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Joey Roeth present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Roeth - have Discovery in both cases and need to talk with the DA regarding resolution.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on October 24, 2016 at 10:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 10:09 a.m.
State's
Defendant's
By Atty Joey Roeth
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Status hearing on September 13, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

11:53 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Joey Roeth.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Roeth will be representing the defendant.  Atty Roeth confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Atty Roeth enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Court will set both cases for Status Hearing on September 13, 2016 at 10:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 11:56  a.m.
Defendant called in regards to her missed court date, informed her that the Court ordered a warrant and stayed it til 08/01/2016 at 11:30 a.m. and she needed to appear in court on that date and time.
Warrant letter sent to the defendant - defendant to appear in court on 08/01/2016 at 11:30 a.m. or warrant will be issued.

9:31 a.m.  No Appearance by the defendant.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court orders a warrant - stayed til August 1, 2016 at 11:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 9:32 a.m.
**PROCESSING COMPLETE**
